{"step_by_step_thinking": "The ECA, or External Carotid Artery, has several branches that supply the nasal septum. These include the Anterior Ethmoidal Artery (A), the Facial Artery (C), and the Superior Labial Artery (D). The Sphenopalatine Artery (B), however, is not a branch of the ECA, but rather a branch of the Maxillary Artery, which is a branch of the Internal Carotid Artery.", "answer_choice": "B"}
